revised_title: The Exceeding Minuteness of Gold Atoms and the Thickness of Gold on Gilt-Wire
tldr: The author investigates the thickness of gold on gilt-wire and demonstrates the minuteness of gold atoms. By examining the specific gravities of gold and silver, the author concludes that the thickness of the gold layer is extremely thin, and that a single grain of gold can cover 98 yards of wire. This finding supports the atomic theory and the notion that gold atoms are very small.
